column5: Got out to Ashbridges Bay for a couple hours today. Went 1 for 1. First Brown trout ever for me! weighed 6 lbs and was about 24 inches. She took a bucktail spinner. heres a couple pics....  -Ben
Nice Brown Ben !
WOW! Nice catch! And on a bucktail spinner too!
nice trout, congrats on ur catch!
Nice size trout for your first trout ever.Good for you.  MTP
Ben, long time no post. Beauty Square Tail!
Nice fish dude
Congratulations on your first Brown Trout - what a beautiful fish.  007
Good stuff!

Just when i was startin to think there were no more fish in there....feels good, that was my first fish sinse fall because I dont ice fish  . I was talkin to a concervation officer rigth after i caught her, liscence check lol. and he was saying that it was proboly a hatchery fish from new york because it had a pelvic fin clipped. Do they clip hatchery fish from Ontario?
Great fish congrats  DAve
Nice fish Ben keep it up never give up hope
BEAUTY BROWN   CONGRATS!!!
Nicely done!!!  That is a great lookin Brown that you caught there!
Great stuff! Always nice to see someone catch something so close to where I live! Congrats! HH
Nice clean lookin fish, good work...
right on dude!  good work!  UF

Great catch ben..  ...beauty brown trout, and on a bucktail spinner,thats the first time i have heard of a brown hitting a bucktail,i take it you were after pike ...well that brown will top a pike anyday....cheers
Hey Kewl!  Never hooked up with a brownie on that side...  Nice fish!  tight loops  HD
While that is a lovely fish was anyone going to tell him that the pike he was fishing for are out of season? Can't think of anything else you would try to catch with a bucktail.
Beauty trout.  Congrats.
I was using a 1/8 oz, 1/2 inch blue fox spinner that I put a bucktal trebble on.... not really a pike lure at all

I have fished trout for years with spinners, often with dressed hooks (hair, feathers etc.) and I've fished early season trout with 5" rapalas very successfully.  I caught my biggest pike at 43" on the same rapala. I can't fathom why anyone would ASSUME someone was targetting OOS fish at the mention of a lure type.  Many lures are good for multiple species.  Are we going to call for a restriction of lure types which are allowed if there happens to be a OOS species that may hit said lure?  Too much!
hello every1 where in ashbrigdes bay is a place to fish?? i have never fished there. If ya no of ne good spots in toronto let me no (fishin from shore)
